context: Nutanix, Inc. is a hybrid multicloud computing company focused on hyperconverged infrastructure, cloud platform, and virtualization. Enterprise HCI adoption accelerating.

competitors.name: VMware EVO:RAIL / VMware VSAN
competitors.notes: VMware's response to Nutanix, combining vSphere with software-defined storage (VSAN). EVO:RAIL was VMware's hyper-converged appliance program launched in 2014, while VSAN was the underlying storage virtualization technology.

competitors.name: SimpliVity
competitors.notes: Independent HCI vendor founded in 2009, offering hyper-converged infrastructure with integrated data protection and WAN optimization. SimpliVity was a strong competitor before being acquired by HPE in 2017.

competitors.name: EMC VCE VxRail
competitors.notes: EMC (pre-Dell merger) was beginning to develop hyper-converged solutions through its VCE joint venture. VxRail would be officially launched in 2014 as a VMware-based HCI appliance.

competitors.name: Pivot3
competitors.notes: HCI vendor focusing on virtual desktop infrastructure (VDI) and surveillance applications, competing in specific vertical markets.

competitors.name: Scale Computing
competitors.notes: HCI solution targeting SMB market with integrated hypervisor (KVM-based), positioned as a simpler, more affordable alternative for smaller organizations.

competitors.name: Maxta
competitors.notes: Software-only hyper-converged infrastructure company that worked with commodity hardware, competing on a different model than Nutanix's appliance approach.

competitors.name: Traditional 3-tier Infrastructure
competitors.notes: Traditional separate compute (servers), storage (SAN/NAS), and networking from vendors like Cisco, NetApp, EMC, and HP represented the legacy architecture that HCI was replacing.
